direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods have nearly identical structures and handle similar parameters, focusing on order creation and validation.
Both methods are responsible for placing new orders, though sorOrder uses smart order routing (SOR) while newOrder does not.
Both methods involve order management and may handle similar exceptions related to order processing.
Both methods interact with order-related resources and may share similar patterns in accessing and manipulating these resources.
Both methods depend on similar underlying dependencies, such as order validation and request handling, making them suitable for cross-testing.
Both methods involve complex order placement, though ocoOrder handles OCO (One-Cancels-the-Other) orders, which can be tested similarly.
Both methods access order-related data, though getOpenOrders retrieves open orders, which can be tested similarly for resource access patterns.
Both methods access trade-related data, though myTrades retrieves trade history, which can be tested similarly for resource access patterns.
Both methods depend on order-related functionalities and may share similar dependencies on rate limiting mechanisms.
Both methods access account-related data, though commission retrieves commission rates, which can be tested similarly for resource access patterns.
